comments.commentBody: TrumpSpeak is a lot like Orwell's Newspeak. Short phrases to trigger coarse emotions that kill independent thought.
But you don't believe this is why he lost, do you?
Yes, it is if you have no claim of knowledge,  experience  or heart to motivate you.
Here's when, Hank:  2010 Midterms, and 2014 Midterms, biggest losses for Democrats in Senate, House, and statehouses since 1945, and 1932, respectively.  Democrats should learn to vote again!
"Sane and rational choice"? When was the last time the typical Republican voter been interested in the "sane and rational" choice?
That's normal politics. Excuse me, I thought you were suggesting you had an insight.

Absolutely. Republicans have blamed Obama from the start, and can point to his record as proof. Unfortunately, his record has been written more by Republicans like Mitch McConnell, aka "Senator No."--the man who declared the goal of the GOP was to make Obama a one-term president, less than a month after his election. The people of Kentucky should be so proud.

@anne,
That's what I was 1/2 guessing 1/2 wondering and why I replied as I did.

@Charles,
Now THAT was good. "Pretty, pretty, pretty good." (Thanks Larry and Bernie).

3-15-16@11:58 pm

So after throwing his friend and mentor under the bus(or perhaps each other) then he wonders why he never caught on as the values guy. Kasich is the only guy who stayed true to himself, and look where it got him.

It's all over, except the crying. Trump will be the nominee. There is zero reason to believe Rubio's supporters will back Cruz, and I doubt Kasich will be any more effective as spoiler than he was as a candidate. Even if Kasich ties up Pennsylvania and Maryland, Trump will tie up the nomination by California on June 7th, which is the best thing that could happen to the GOP, because a candidate selected by convention would likely finish third, behind Hillary and Donald.
There's always the Salvation Army... but it's doubtful that even they would embrace him...
Thought you were referring to Obama when you said narcissist with a future....
Ignorant, provincial, smarmy, and no sense of what it might be like to be another person.  Still this narcissist might have future.

The fact is Trump lost the evangelicals to Cruz in Iowa. Now Cruz and Trump split them what's so cosmic about that? The simple fact is there are more racists supporting Trump, period.

"Cruz was fighting illegal issues" is an interesting claim given again, the fact that Cruz proposed an amendment to the Senate's immigration bill that would have been favorable to illegal immigrants.

Cruz discussing his proposed amendment, May 21, 2013: "They [illegal immigrants] would still be eligible for legal status and indeed, under the terms of the bill, they would be eligible for LPR [Lawful Permanent Resident] status....I don’t want immigration reform to fail. I want immigration reform to pass. And so I would urge people of good faith on both sides of the aisle if the objective is to pass common sense immigration reform that secures the borders, that improves legal immigration and that allows those who are here illegally to come in out of the shadows."

Rafael Edward Cruz lies about immigration just as much as Trump lies about really having a plan for America. The reality that Rafael Edward Cruz's doesn't discuss is how his father was a welfare queen living off the government dole, receiving free medical care, education, job training, food and housing, all because he was a Cuban immigrant; allowed under the power of a Presidential Executive Order. Facts? I've got a lot more on Rafael Edward Cruz and I'm happy to share them.

Suspension of Marco will result in Trump's nomination on the GOP side.

Republicans are swept by Donald's hatred remarks which make this country in a danger. What's common ground for republicans is that they are still in denial that Barack Obama won the election because he is African American.

Historically, freedom of speech was introduced to stop government from muzzling opponents and to protect minorities's rights - voice to be heard in the public space. Recently, and mind-bogglingly, Freedom Caucus and Tea Party goers have gone too far showing pictures of crosshaired politicians whom they don't like at their venues and spreading pure hatreds to certain groups of people. Freedom of speech doesn't absolve someone of moral obligations, for which people have to be hold accountable for what they saying. I'm not suggesting hate speeches ought to be punished by laws but should've been booed down by the public. What's happening is deeply saddening for me.

Another frowning thing for me, is the fact that Donald's campaign has gained so much attentions and supporters. And he will be the nominee in one of our major political parties.
As much as I sneer at Obama, I was amazed at Mini Marco's constant broadsides about Obama.  A one-trick pony, trained to blow a dog whistle.
Rubio was, simply, the emptiest of suits.
Mr Trump keeps tossing his opponents out of the ring. How appropriate.

I think the patient might be better counseled to let go of attachments, including attachments to political outcomes. One's ideals and the actions we can take as individuals, or contributing to a collective, are within our personal control. Once given, once shared, what more can one do? Beyond that, compassion for one's "enemy" opens avenues for closure. And the recognition of past discrimination celebrates greater effort made by some. But desire need not be poisoned by anger, not if healing is the aim.

You are missing the truth!

The American educational system is primarily designed to keep people off the labor market for as long as possible.

If you only consider THAT one fact, so much of what you are criticizing makes perfect sense.

Of course, I don't support these things any more than you do, taopraxis, but if you do not correctly identify the problem, you cannot easily solve it.

and Elke
I think he is BURIED in ELMIRA, NY.
Noticed that, too. Uh oh.
The report of his birthplace is greatly exaggerated. . . :)
Mark Twain was born where?

Rubio was so arrogant against President Obama, saying that he had no class, and sitting on that Fox couch thinking he would "pass".  Well, you got yours Rubio.  Not even your Cubanos voted for you.  Kiss good-bye to your political career.
Explication reserved for confidential circles only.

Frank Bruni was one of those who were impressed by Rubio:
http://bruni.blogs.nytimes.com/2015/03/11/you-will-be-hearing-a-lot-more...

Sen. Rubio was always an empty suit peddling faux policy and almost always pandering to someone, and too cowardly to maintain his initial stand on immigration. He really went into a tailspin when he was revealed as a robot by the New Jersey governor.

Now that his own state has rejected him, I get the feeling that his con game was revealed. Otherwise, one can regard that he finally reached the level where his incompetency was evident.

Lately, he should have taken to heart some old folk wisdom: Never wrestle with a pig-you get dirty and the pig enjoys it.

May the rest of us be protected from people who think as you do, Sara.  I'm trying to wish you the best anyway, but it's hard.  Then again it takes all kinds.  I'm voting with great enthusiasm for Hillary Clinton -- but if Bernie Sanders wins the nomination I'll bust my tail to get him elected too.  Anyone who doesn't feel similarly yet calls themself "progressive" is frightening, given what's at stake.

Monica???  Really???  You're not going to vote for Clinton because of Monica?  Her husband behaved like a 12 year old.  But she defended him against a Republican witch hunt.  I have nothing against Monica Lewinsky; I empathize with what she went through.  I also cannot believe you're going to base your vote on what should have remained a private matter but was made public by a crazy obsessive named Kenneth Starr, and his crazy party that impeached a sitting president for having a consensual affair with a younger woman.  The politics of sex is complicated, yes.  But your reaction is just bizarre.

And apparently you're just as "progressive" in all the places it doesn't matter.  Your vote and your brain matter.  If you don't care about yourself try to consider the rest of us.  Don't throw away both vote and brain because you're frustrated.  Clinton or Sanders must beat Trump or we're all going to suffer -- and the petulance of "progressives" like you will be part of what does that.  Take a breath and think about what you're saying.  Then vote for the Democrat and stop being silly about this.

My deepest thanks to the Hillary voters across the states that finally put her over the top tonight. Particularly to women and people of color who are powering her victory. It is over for all intents and purposes. Onward to November and the defeat of the Donald.
The question that I have never seen answered is why, Bernie having assumed the role of grand inquisitor in creating this bogus issue, she should dance to his fiddle to prove there is nothing to it.
You don't have to be "more" corrupt, just corrupt..

The request to release Goldman Sachs speeches content did *not* originate with Bernie Sanders. Even the NYT Editorial Board has asked her to release the transcripts or recordings. She should. It is a diversion that she does not need. It is a void upon which people project their assumptions. Why would that be of benefit to her campaign? (Unless the full transcripts would do even worse damage ... see what I mean?)
Bernie Sanders does look like a spoiler, but his popularity show many people like his ideas, even if he doesn't know how to turn them into reality.
Cruz's youth should be less of a sign of his fitness for the presidency than the fact that not a single Senator--Republican or Democrat--endorsed him.
Here's when, Hank:  2010 Midterms, and 2014 Midterms, biggest losses for Democrats in Senate, House, and statehouses since 1945, and 1932, respectively.  Democrats should learn to vote again!

Soccer players have very similar (often higher) rates of concussion than football players.  Surely you don't imagine those head bounces are consequence-free!  Did you miss the news that Brandi Chastain just announced that she's donating her brain to research?

Ah, an Earthling with a brain. How refreshing.
But, the Cassowary only got it very close. 2,000 years ago, the Romans referred to it as "Bread and Circuses". Today, we watch from our Entertainment Centers, everyone is given a view according to his wallet, and we stuff ourselves in sedentary gluttony.
We haven’t evolved at all, probably due to our exclusive use of our smaller brain.
Momentarily switching to my larger brain, I am including myself in the indictment.
The lawyers must be salivating profusely.
And they get paid VERY handsomely for their participation. Eyes wide open.  It's amazing what people will compromise for the almighty dollar.

And frankly, the players don't care either - they are making a fortune and while their careers don't last decades, they walk away with lots of money.  Money isn't worth it to me, but in the US we have choices.

Footballers are modern-day gladiators to their corporate masters. They entertain the crowd in the arena and are utterly disposable. Their future health outside of that arena is of no concerns to their masters. Or the crowd.
Your bias is showing.  Everything has a cause.

The NFL lawyers from Bancroft just muddled this. CTE has no cause and needs research. Miller's statements consistent with long-term NFL view (try League of Denial).

Miller's views have no bearing on the litigation.

We have devolved into lunacy.
